we're approaching winter so it's time
for me to bring my Goldie's back indoors
to a small indoor pond many of you have
reached out to me in social media
because you definitely liked what you
saw on my first video so this is a great
opportunity for me to show you how I do
it step by step so you can do the same
for yourself just for time-consuming
purposes I went ahead and took the Scot
container and I put some gravel in there
just simply get a stock container you
can get them anywhere on Amazon or Ebay
and then you can go to your local pet
store and you can pick up some gravel
you can choose whatever color suits you
best make sure you wash them out
thoroughly and then simply put them in
there so now I added a tetra pond
fountain filter you can find these on
amazon.com I'm truly not really a big
fan of these I much prefer to use my
crystal flow because it has a UV
sterilizer in it to help keep the water
clear but it's currently being used for
my goldfish upstairs where there are
outdoors so I'm gonna go ahead and use
this for now so you can find these on
Amazon it's not too expensive
so it might be a great option for you I
also added with some bio meteor in there
to enhance it a bit and I also put some
crushed corals because where I live the
pH is pretty low here so I put some
crushed corals so it can help raise the
pH and help stabilize it because
goldfish prefers higher pH you're also
going to need oxygen for your small
indoor pond right here is an air pump
all these accessories here you can find
them on amazon.com this one here is from
tetra Whisperer I believe it's between
it's 6200 gallon air pump right over
here I have some air tubing is about 25
feet and over here we have some ear
stones these are accessories to help
beautify your pond not only that it
pumps oxygen within your pond but it
also lights up as well so it's
definitely gonna be a nice beautiful
display right here is of air valve
you're gonna use these your files to
connect your accessories so you're gonna
first take your pump
you're gonna connect your pump over to
the ear tubing from the ear tubing
you're gonna go right here and connect
it here and then you also gonna take
your tubing and make them individual
through these valves and you're gonna
connect them to the accessories and from
the accessories you're going to
distribute to different parts of the
tank so oxygen can flow throughout now
that we connected the air tubing to the
pump you may want to consider
getting yourself some black ear tubing
swigging camouflage with the background
of the pond since it's dark I only
happen to have clear ear tubing at the

right over here you may notice I have
the pump and from the pump we also have

one with a strip here stone that lights

valve and makes its way down to the pump
right over here you may notice I have a
heater you may or may not need a heater
my living room temperature drops in the
winter really low so I tend to get
myself a heater so I can keep the
temperatures anywhere around 70 degrees
because that's what my goldfish is used
to even though I know they can handle a
lot less and you may also want to get
yourself a thermometer just throw it in
there so you can definitely keep an eye
on the temperatures so we're gonna go
ahead and fill up the pond now that we
filled up the pond you'll notice I only
have the filter running and I didn't
turn on any of the other accessories
that's only because I want the tank to
have a proper cycle and I'm gonna allow
it to run for a few weeks the reason I'm
gonna do this because there's no
immediate rush for me to bring my
goldfish down and I highly suggest you
guys do the same even though there are
products out there to help you speed the

attachments but you may notice that I
have a domed the way the water is

attachment over the others because it
keeps the water contained and spilling
out into your floor's and splashed all

want to consider that option as well
okay guys these are some of the products

we also have here prime a lot of people

it also to talk suffice ammonia nitrates
and night
right here is the most important thing
where I believe everyone should have

nitrates nitrites this is definitely
something you want to want to use when

so I definitely highly suggest you get
